H0.text: To absorb sunlight is one function of tree roots.

H1.text: To absorb water is one function of tree roots.

H2.text: To make seeds is one function of tree roots.

H3.text: To make food is one function of tree roots.

A4.text: Root epidermal cells and root hairs take up soil water and dissolved ions; these are then conducted to the shoot via the xylem.

A5.text: Root architecture (depth, spread) determines access to water and nutrients in different soil horizons.
